posts.name: dragon
posts.cooked: Add an option to not notify my contacts that I have changed phone number

link_counts.title: Signal Blog: You Can Change Your Number

posts.cooked:
On Android at least you can unregister and re-register using a new number without losing your data, which effectively does what you want. What would the proposed option do differently from what is available now? (Aside from working on iOS, which doesn‚Äôt support unregistering without losing data, AFAIK)

I imagine once usernames and phone number privacy are released, this will essentially be implemented.

Herohtar:

On Android at least you can unregister and re-register using a new number without losing your data

Are you sure this is still possible? I do not see how.
The account settings now only offers to delete the account, which warns about losing all messages and profile data.

chynric:

Are you sure this is still possible?

Yes, go to Settings > Privacy > Advanced, then disable the ‚ÄúSignal messages and calls‚Äù toggle. That will unregister your number. Then toggle it back on, and unless they changed something or I‚Äôm remembering incorrectly, it will allow you to choose a new number when re-registering.

Is this that you don‚Äôt want the other party at all to notice this?

I imagine it would be rather strange not being able to call somebody but messages still come through.

It can also be a security concern if the other party has a different number but you don‚Äôt notice.

Herohtar:

On Android at least you can unregister and re-register using a new number without losing your data

I haven‚Äôt tested it yet and didn‚Äôt deep dive into the code (so much to do lately) but using the change number should keep your safety number in tact. This means that unregistering and re registering will display the good old ‚Äúyour safety number has changed banner‚Äù having not much difference to the first notification.

Leptopoda:

unregistering and re registering will display the good old ‚Äúyour safety number has changed banner‚Äù having not much difference to the first notification.

I was specifically talking about re-registering with a new number (presumably so your contacts no longer know how to contact you), in which case they won‚Äôt see anything other than that you no longer are using Signal. If you message them again from the new number there won‚Äôt be a safety number change alert because you‚Äôll be a completely new contact.

You‚Äôre right
I shouldn‚Äôt post before my first coffee when the brain is still in hibernation.

dragon:

notify my contacts

Note that nobody is actually notified. Your phone number is included in every message/(delivery/read)receipt/typing indicator.

Herohtar:

this will essentially be implemented.

Yeah, phone number sharing setting allows you to hide phone numbers from everyone not in contacts. So you first choose to share number only with contacts, remove anyone from contacts that you don‚Äôt want seeing the new number, change to a new number.

Leptopoda:

It can also be a security concern if the other party has a different number but you don‚Äôt notice.

Haven‚Äôt tested, but if my contact (imported from device contacts) changes their number in signal, will the number under their profile picture change as well?

My conditions:

  1. I have the same phone but I got new phone number.
  2. My requirement is to NOT inform existing users of my new phone number.
  3. Existing users do NOT don‚Äôt know my phone number.
  4. The contacts that I want to have my new phone number I have send new phone number through Signal ordinary message. My friends added my phone number to there Contact application.
  5. I have manually unlinked desktop client.
  6. I am not member of any Signal group.
  7. My Signal is 5.32.0 on Android 11.

Now:
8. I did:

Herohtar:

Yes, go to Settings > Privacy > Advanced , then disable the ‚ÄúSignal messages and calls‚Äù toggle.

and I can confirm this works perfectly.
9. I have got dialog to enter phone number. I entered new phone number.
10. I have received SMS confirmation message. SMS was automatically recognized by Signal app.
11. New dialog appeared to enter PIN number. I entered exactly the same PIN as I already have had before unregistering (don‚Äôt know if this is requirement, but I have very lengthy PIN so it is OK to have the same one).
12. Signal contact history appeared just like before. No data was lost.

RECAP: I can confirm unregistering and registering back preserves Signal message history at least on Signal/Android I have tested.

GLITCH:
The only interesting thing is existing ‚ÄúNote to Self‚Äù that becomes like this (my note to self messages).

pic.png360√ó800 33.8 KB

Interesting at the top is unlocked phone icon and at the bottom is Enable Signal for SMS button. It looks to me, my ‚ÄúNote to Self‚Äù become related to my old phone number.

I can create new Note to Self message if in main contact history window I tap on blue pencil icon and select Note to Self contact and send some message. In main contact history window now I have old and new Note to Self. This is something I was not expecting, but it is not a major problem. I just have some old messages there, that I will eventually delete.

If someone likes to investigate I created debug log.

https://debuglogs.org/android/5.32.0/c530d60179ad36e396cb71f749543e54ee8eb05e3cb5ad8c35c12d9cf89018af

EDIT: I have now checked how does it appear in my friend‚Äôs phone. Not so nice. For my contact there are now two entries:

  • my old phone number message history (when opened ‚ÄúEnable Signal for SMS‚Äù button at the bottom is displayed - probably relates to my old phone number, I haven‚Äôt tried that, because this old phone number now has some other person)
  • my new phone number message history (works like expected)

shellSignal:

The only interesting thing is existing ‚ÄúNote to Self‚Äù that becomes like this (my note to self messages).

pic.png360√ó800 33.8 KB

Interesting at the top is unlocked phone icon and at the bottom is Enable Signal for SMS button. It looks to me, my ‚ÄúNote to Self‚Äù become related to my old phone number.

That is expected; ‚ÄúNote To Self‚Äù is just a conversation with your phone number. Signal simply checks to see if the phone number is yours, and if it is, it shows the name as ‚ÄúNote To Self‚Äù and special-cases a bunch of things. If your number ever changes (as you have discovered) it will no longer be a special case and just show up as a regular contact with your old phone number. It shows the ‚ÄúEnable SMS‚Äù option because you unregistered your previous number and it is currently not registered with Signal, so can only receive SMS.

I‚Äôm curious, does the new ‚ÄúChange Number‚Äù feature preserve your Note To Self history? I would expect it to, but I haven‚Äôt seen anyone mention that.

shellSignal:

I have now checked how does it appear in my friend‚Äôs phone. Not so nice. For my contact there are now two entries:

  • my old phone number message history (when opened ‚ÄúEnable Signal for SMS‚Äù button at the bottom is displayed - probably relates to my old phone number, I haven‚Äôt tried that, because this old phone number now has some other person)
  • my new phone number message history (works like expected)

This is also expected ‚Äì you are literally now a different contact, so of course your contacts are going to have a brand new conversation with you. That‚Äôs how it works in any messenger if you create a new account (which is effectively what you are doing by unregistering and registering with a different number, even though Signal doesn‚Äôt have ‚Äúaccounts‚Äù in the traditional sense). That‚Äôs exactly why the ‚ÄúChange Number‚Äù feature was built, so that you can change your number without showing up as a new/different contact for everyone, which requires ‚Äúnotifying‚Äù your contacts.

Herohtar:

I‚Äôm curious, does the new ‚ÄúChange Number‚Äù feature preserve your Note To Self history? I would expect it to, but I haven‚Äôt seen anyone mention that.

All chat histories for all parties are preserved because ACI doesn‚Äôt change.

shellSignal:
  • My requirement is to NOT inform existing users of my new phone number.
  • Existing users do NOT don‚Äôt know my phone number.
  • The contacts that I want to have my new phone number I have send new phone number through Signal ordinary message. My friends added my phone number to there Contact application.

After phone number hiding become available you can use it to achieve this without splitting history.

posts.name: Talya (she/her)
posts.cooked:
This is now possible with Phone Number Privacy.

Signal Wiki ‚Äì 17 Oct 24

Phone Number Privacy - Signal Wiki
